required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acceptability and Efficacy of the Zemedy App for Irritable Bowel Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Acceptability and Efficacy of the Zemedy App for Irritable Bowel Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to assess if a new self-help app for IBS is an acceptable and effective intervention for improving the overall quality of life in patients with Irritable Bowel Syndrome.

primary_outcome.measure: Irritable Bowel Syndrome Quality of Life
primary_outcome.description: A self-report measure of health related quality of life (HRQL) in people with irritable bowel syndrome. Scores range from 0 to 100. Higher scores are a worse outcome.
a self-report measure of GI symptom severity. Scores range from 0 to 78. Higher scores are a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.description: self-report measure of anxiety specific to visceral sensations. Scores range from 0 to 75. Higher scores are a worse outcome.
self-report measure of catastrophizing specific to GI symptoms. Scores range from 0 to 64. Higher scores are a worse outcome.
self-report measure of fear of food. Scores range from 0 to 90. Higher scores are a worse outcome.
self-report measure of depressive symptoms. Scores range from 0 to 27. Higher scores are a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale - Depression Subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Self-report measure of depressive symptoms. Scores ranges from 0 to 42. Higher scores represent worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale - Stress Subscale
secondary_outcome.description: The stress subscale measures emotional reactivity to perceived stress. Scores range from 0-42 with higher scores representing worse stress reactivity.

secondary_outcome.measure: Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale - Anxiety Subscale
secondary_outcome.description: Measures affective and physical symptoms of anxiety. Scores range from 0-42 with higher scores representing worse anxiety.

arm_group.description: Participants will have immediate access to the self-help app. They will take 8 weeks to work through the content at their own pace.

Participants in the waitlist will receive no intervention for 8 weeks, other than a few "check in" emails from study personnel. At the end of 8 weeks, they will be crossed over to the active treatment group and will be given access to the app.

intervention.intervention_name: Zemedy App for Irritable Bowel Syndrome
intervention.description: The Zemedy App for irritable bowel syndrome is designed to be an engaging, self-help app for people with irritable bowel syndrome. It is based on empirically supported cognitive-behavioral, and GI focused hypnotherapy interventions for IBS.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of IBS. Own a smart phone. Speak English
Exclusion Criteria:
- Under age of consent (18) Diagnosed with another GI disorder (e.g. celiac disease, inflammatory bowel disease)

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 146 potential participants were consented and screened. 25 individuals met exclusion criteria (severe depression) and were not randomized.

group.title: Immediate Treatment
group.description: Participants will have immediate access to the self-help app. They will take 8 weeks to work through the content at their own pace. Zemedy App for IBS: The Zemedy App for IBS is designed to be an engaging, self-help app for people with irritable bowel syndrome. It is based on empirically supported cognitive-behavioral, and GI focused hypnotherapy interventions for IBS.

group.title: Waitlist Control
group.description: Participants in the waitlist will receive no intervention for 8 weeks, other than a few "check in" emails from study personnel. At the end of 8 weeks, they will be crossed over to the active treatment group and will be given access to the app.

group.title: Immediate Treatment
group.description: Participants will have immediate access to the self-help app. They will take 8 weeks to work through the content at their own pace. Zemedy App for IBS: The Zemedy App for IBS is designed to be an engaging, self-help app for people with irritable bowel syndrome. It is based on empirically supported cognitive-behavioral, and GI focused hypnotherapy interventions for IBS.

group.title: Waitlist Control
group.description: Participants in the waitlist will receive no intervention for 8 weeks, other than a few "check in" emails from study personnel. At the end of 8 weeks, they will be crossed over to the active treatment group and will be given access to the app.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Irritable Bowel Syndrome Quality of Life
measure.description: Scale scores range from 0-100 with higher scores reflecting more impairment (worse outcome)

measure.title: Gastrointestinal Symptom Rating Scale
measure.description: Scale scores range from 0-78 with high scores representing worse GI symptoms.

measure.title: GI Cognitions Questionnaire
measure.description: Scale measures distorted, catastrophic beliefs about the social and occupational implications of having gastrointestinal symptoms. Scale scores range from 0 to 64 with higher scores representing worse outcomes (more distorted, catastrophic beliefs about GI symptoms)

measure.title: Visceral Sensitivity Index
measure.description: Scale measures anxiety about visceral (gut) sensations. Scale scores range from 0 to 75 with higher scores representing more anxiety.

measure.title: Fear of Food Questionnaire
measure.description: Scale measures fear of food and eating. Scale scores range from 0-90 with higher scores representing more fear and impairment.

measure.title: Patient Health Questionnaire 9
measure.description: The PHQ measures the frequency of the 9 cardinal symptoms of depression. Scale score range from 0-27 with higher scores representing more severe/frequent depressive symptoms.

measure.title: Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale - Depression Subscale
measure.description: The depression subscale of the Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale (DASS) ranges from 0-42 with higher scores representing worse depression.

measure.title: Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale - Stress Subscale
measure.description: The Stress subscale of DASS measures emotional reactivity to perceived stress. It ranges from 0-42 with higher scores reflecting more distress.

measure.title: Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale - Anxiety Subscale
measure.description: The Anxiety subscale of the DASS measures the affective and physical symptoms of anxiety. It ranges from 0-42 with higher scores representing worse anxiety.

outcome.title: Irritable Bowel Syndrome Quality of Life
outcome.description: A self-report measure of health related quality of life (HRQL) in people with irritable bowel syndrome. Scores range from 0 to 100. Higher scores are a worse outcome.

group.title: Immediate Treatment
group.description: Participants will have immediate access to the self-help app. They will take 8 weeks to work through the content at their own pace. Zemedy App for IBS: The Zemedy App for IBS is designed to be an engaging, self-help app for people with irritable bowel syndrome. It is based on empirically supported cognitive-behavioral, and GI focused hypnotherapy interventions for IBS.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: As is the case with most internet trials we experienced significant attrition from both arms. In the final publication, multiple imputation will be used to account for missing data and both treatment completer and intent-to-treat results will be reported.
